text: James Fitzroy McCarthy (1853–1919) was an Irish surveyor and cartographer who played a prominent role in the delimitation of Thailand (then known as Siam)'s borders in the late nineteenth century, helping transform the country into a modern nation-state. He served as the first Director-General of the Royal Thai Survey Department, which was established in 1885. ==Further reading== * Category:Irish surveyors Category:British surveyors Category:British cartographers Category:Expatriates in the Rattanakosin Kingdom Category:British expatriates in Thailand Category:1853 births Category:1919 deaths
title: James McCarthy (surveyor)
